Description: Ostracon, fragment of a light-brown pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, interior slightly grooved and scored, exterior covered with a slightly burnished cream-coloured slip and with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as pressed meat from the storeroom of the ka of the living Ra.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393194) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393194)
